intro: Iochroma lyciifolium, commonly known as the silverleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant has silver-gray foliage, giving it its common name, and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Iochroma lyciifolium is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees.
